item.title: Christian add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "A mountain keeps an echo deep inside. That's how I hold your voice." -- Rumi

item.title: Christian add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description:
"If this nation is to be wise as well as strong, if we are to achieve our destiny, then we need more new ideas for more wise men reading more good books in more public libraries. These libraries should be open to allâ€”except the censor. We must know all the facts and hear all the alternatives and listen to all the criticisms. Let us welcome controversial books and controversial authors. For the Bill of Rights is the guardian of our security as well as our liberty.
<i>[Response to questionnaire in Saturday Review, October 29 1960]</i>" -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Christian add a quote by Robert F. Kennedy
item.description: "There are those that look at things the way they are, and ask why? I dream of things that never were, and ask why not?" -- Robert F. Kennedy

item.title: Christian add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "Let there be spaces in your togetherness, And let the winds of the heavens dance between you. Love one another but make not a bond of love: Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls. Fill each other's cup but drink not from one cup. Give one another of your bread but eat not from the same loaf. Sing and dance together and be joyous, but let each one of you be alone, Even as the strings of a lute are alone though they quiver with the same music. Give your hearts, but not into each other's keeping. For only the hand of Life can contain your hearts. And stand together, yet not too near together: For the pillars of the temple stand apart, And the oak tree and the cypress grow not in each other's shadow." -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Christian add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Christian add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "In Silence there is eloquence. Stop weaving and see how the pattern improves." -- Rumi

item.title: Christian add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Love is a better master than duty." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Christian add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge. That myth is more potent than history. That dreams are more powerful than facts. That hope always triumphs over experience. That laughter is the only cure for grief. And I believe that love is stronger than death." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: Christian add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Sit, be still, and listen, because you're drunk and we're at the edge of the roof." -- Rumi

item.title: Christian add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "We love the things we love for what they are." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Christian add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "My bounty is as boundless as the sea, My love as deep; the more I give to thee, The more I have, for both are infinite." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Christian add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "The love of learning, the sequestered nooks, And all the sweet serenity of books" -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Christian add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "These woods are lovely, dark and deep, But I have promises to keep, And miles to go before I sleep, And miles to go before I sleep." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Christian add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Everybody can be great...because anybody can serve. You don't have to have a college degree to serve. You don't have to make your subject and verb agree to serve. You only need a heart full of grace. A soul generated by love." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Christian add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Christian add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it." -- Rumi

item.title: Christian add a quote by Marthe Troly-Curtin
item.description: "Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time." -- Marthe Troly-Curtin

item.title: Christian add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "You were born with wings, why prefer to crawl through life?" -- Rumi

item.title: Christian add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Beauty surrounds us." -- Rumi

item.title: Christian add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "That which God said to the rose, and caused it to laugh in full-blown beauty, He said to my heart, and made it a hundred times more beautiful." -- Rumi

item.title: Christian add a quote by Jalal Ad-Din Rumi
item.description:
"Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and rightdoing there is a field. I'll meet you there.
When the soul lies down in that grass the world is too full to talk about." -- Jalal Ad-Din Rumi

item.title: Christian add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "This poetry. I never know what I'm going to say." -- Rumi

item.title: Christian add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "When you do things from your soul, you feel a river moving in you, a joy." -- Rumi

item.title: Christian add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Let the beauty we love be what we do. There are hundreds of ways to kneel and kiss the ground." -- Rumi

item.title: Christian add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Who could be so lucky? Who comes to a lake for water and sees the reflection of moon." -- Rumi

item.title: Christian add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Is it really so that the one I love is everywhere?" -- Rumi

item.title: Christian add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "In your light I learn how to love. In your beauty, how to make poems. You dance inside my chest where no-one sees you, but sometimes I do, and that sight becomes this art." -- Rumi

item.title: Christian add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Let yourself be drawn by the stronger pull of that which you truly love." -- Rumi

item.title: Christian add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "Safeguarding the rights of others is the most noble and beautiful end of a human being." -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Christian add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "All that spirits desire, spirits attain." -- Khalil Gibran
